parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided Facebook post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being considered electoral propaganda, it's a factor to consider.  It suggests the post might not be officially sanctioned by a political party or candidate.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions and endorses Cǎlin Georgescu, implicitly contrasting him with a USR candidate. This directly refers to a candidate participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  Its reach estimate (100K-500K) and the targeting of Maramureș County clearly indicate it's intended for a wide audience, not a personal communication. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's concluding statement, "Voi vota Cǎlin Georgescu, nicidecum un candidat USR! Este singurul care a avut curajul sǎ-mi rǎspundǎ la toate ȋntrebǎrile privind viziunea pe care o are ṣi consider cǎ el este soluția pentru nevoile actuale ale țǎrii noastre," explicitly advocates for voting for Cǎlin Georgescu and against a USR candidate. This strongly suggests the primary objective is to influence voters' choices in the election, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The overall tone and content are designed to persuade readers to support Georgescu.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents some observations about the political climate and public sentiment, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  The endorsement of a specific candidate and the overtly persuasive language disqualify it from being considered journalistic in nature.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Although the post begins with observations presented as reflections of public opinion, the ultimate aim is not simply to express a personal opinion but to actively promote a specific candidate. The personal opinion serves as a vehicle for electoral advocacy.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>928392119243935</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, given its explicit endorsement of Cǎlin Georgescu, its targeting of a wide audience in Maramureș County through a paid advertisement, and its clear intention to influence voters' choices, strongly suggests it constitutes electoral propaganda.  The absence of a CMF number is a mitigating factor, but the other elements overwhelmingly point towards a violation.  The post fulfills all the criteria outlined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post's persuasive language and focus on influencing voting behavior outweigh the initial presentation of seemingly neutral observations.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Cǎlin Georgescu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>USR Candidate (Unspecified)</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Mircea Cirt, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 928392119243935) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatul Cǎlin Georgescu și denigrează implicit un candidat USR, având un efect electoral clar prin îndemnul la vot pentru un anumit candidat. Postarea, plătită cu o sumă cuprinsă între 1000 și 1500 RON, conform Ad Library, a atins între 60.000 și 70.000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane.  Fraza „Voi vota Cǎlin Georgescu, nicidecum un candidat USR!”, urmată de justificarea alegerii, constituie o propagandă electorală directă, interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.  Contactul poate fi realizat prin email la contact@mirceacirt.ro sau telefonic la +40721288000.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
